oai_dc:dc.dc:title: TRANSFORMATION OF NONBREAKING WAVES OVER A BAR
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Beji, S.
Ohyama, T.
Battjes, J.A.
Nadaoka, K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: nonbreaking waves
bar
wave transformation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Data collected from measurements performed in waves propagating over a trapezoidal bar on a horizontal bottom are used to test a fully nonlinear numerical model. The experiments include both regular and random waves. Wave form evolutions in the shoaling region, the near resonant wave-wave interactions over the bar, and finally the decomposition behind the bar are well predicted. The results provide assurance for the reliability of the numerical model.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
